definitions: To send a painful or unpleasant shock through (someone or something).
To have an unpleasant or discordant effect.
To cause to shake or vibrate.
To strike or collide with something, often with a jarring effect.
examples: The loud noise jars my nerves.
His rude comment jars with the polite atmosphere.
The impact jars the entire car.
The sudden stop jars the passengers forward.
